MetaData.title: Pumpkin CMS Philadelphia PA | Open-Source Headless CMS
MetaData.description: Pumpkin CMS: Fast, flexible, open-source headless CMS for Philadelphia businesses and developers. Built with Next.js, Markdown/MDX, Git-backed. Free forever core. Deploy in minutes.
MetaData.author: Pumpkin CMS Team

searchData.contentSummary: Pumpkin CMS is a modern, open-source, Git-backed headless CMS perfect for Philadelphia agencies, startups, and enterprises. Lightning-fast content editing, Next.js-ready, fully free core with optional cloud hosting.

content.headline: Pumpkin CMS Philadelphia
content.subheadline: The open-source headless CMS Philadelphia developers love. Built for speed, flexibility, and total content freedom.
content.backgroundImageAltText: Philadelphia skyline with Pumpkin CMS interface

content.title: Ready to Launch Your Philadelphia Site with Pumpkin CMS?
content.description: Go live in minutes. No vendor lock-in. Full control with Git. Used by Philly startups, agencies, and enterprises.
content.alt: Launch your site with Pumpkin CMS in Philadelphia

content.headline: Perfect for Philadelphia Agencies & Freelancers
content.subheadline: Deliver faster, charge more, and keep full ownership. Your clients stay happy — you stay in control.
content.backgroundImageAltText: Philadelphia web agency using Pumpkin CMS
content.mainImageAltText: Pumpkin CMS dashboard on multiple devices

content.headline: Enterprise-Ready for Philly Companies
content.subheadline: Multi-site, multi-language, role-based access, webhooks, and SSO — all in the open-source core.
content.backgroundImageAltText: Philadelphia enterprise team using Pumpkin CMS

content.title: Why Philadelphia Loves Pumpkin CMS
content.subtitle: Modern, developer-first, and 100% open source — the CMS Philly actually wants to use.

cards.title: 100% Free & Open Source
cards.description: MIT licensed. No hidden fees. Self-host or use our cloud — you always own your data.
cards.image-alt: Pumpkin CMS open source GitHub repo

cards.title: Blazing Fast Sites
cards.description: Static generation + ISR. Philly sites routinely score 95–100 on Lighthouse.

cards.title: Git-Backend Workflow
cards.description: Content stored as Markdown/MDX in your repo. Full history, PRs, and rollbacks.

cards.title: Philadelphia Community
cards.description: Active Slack, monthly meetups at Indy Hall, and local contributors welcome.

content.title: Core Features Philadelphia Teams Use Daily
content.subtitle: Everything you need — nothing you don’t.

cards.title: Visual Editor + Code
cards.description: Non-technical editors love the clean UI. Devs love full MDX control.

cards.title: Next.js & React Ready
cards.description: First-class support for App Router, SSR, SSG, and Edge.

cards.title: Image Optimization
cards.description: Automatic WebP, AVIF, lazy loading, and CDN delivery.

cards.title: Preview & Drafts
cards.description: Instant previews, scheduled publishing, and content versioning.

cards.title: Multi-Site & Multi-Language
cards.description: Run 50 sites or 10 languages from one Pumpkin instance.

cards.title: Deploy Anywhere
cards.description: Vercel, Netlify, Cloudflare, AWS, or your own server.

content.title: Pumpkin CMS FAQs – Philadelphia Edition
content.subtitle: Common questions from Philly developers and agencies

items.question: Is Pumpkin CMS really free?
items.answer: Yes! The entire core is MIT-licensed and free forever. Optional paid cloud hosting and enterprise support are available.

items.question: Can I self-host Pumpkin CMS?
items.answer: Absolutely. One-click deploy to Vercel/Netlify or run on your own Docker/K8s cluster.

items.question: Do you have a Philadelphia Slack or meetup?
items.answer: Yes! Join our #philly channel in the official Slack and come to our monthly meetups at Indy Hall.

items.question: Does it work with Next.js App Router?
items.answer: Built for it. Full App Router examples in the repo.

items.question: Can editors use it without knowing code?
items.answer: Yes – the block-based visual editor is designed for marketing teams and content editors.

items.question: How do I get help in Philadelphia?
items.answer: Book a free 30-min call with our Philly-based team or hire one of our certified local partners.
